title: How tough is physics in class 11? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer to that depends on a lot of factors: How good are your math skills? You should be able to solve algebra problems fluently.Do you have trouble solving for x?Do you have trouble reading information out of word problems?Are you easily frustrated? (Not a good thing)Are you a memorizer? (NOT a good skill for physics students)Are you a methodical problem solver (a good skill). If you tend to “Oh I just multiply to get the answer” then you are probably not very methodical.Can you see the meaning behind the equations?How closely do you pay attention in class? Physics is a process, so missing pay of the process can leave you lost.What level Physics are you taking? Regular, Honors, AP, IB?Sadly, the teacher … talk to other students who have had your teacher.I taught Physics to freshmen (grade 9). It was a little less math intensive, but they still had to solve the basic types of physics problems and more importantly, they had to understand the concepts behind them. You might struggle in your first couple of chapters of the Physics class because it takes a little while to get into what I call “Physics mode” where you really start to think about what you are doing. The bottom line is that some students find Physics easy to do and some find it almost impossible. It depends on so many factors, probably more than I have listed above. Think about who you are, the skills you have, the resources you have access to. Physics is do-able by all. A lot of the time, you just need to believe in yourself and get help when necessary.
